intro: Licania vaupesiana, commonly known as the Amazonian evergreen tree, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly the Amazon Basin. The plant is characterized by its large, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests. The tree's bark and leaves have been traditionally used in folk medicine for their potential healing properties.
